TopicTitle: SAS gets deactivated when using cursor on PS4

Articles.Content:
Hey,

 

When in flight and I have SAS target activated, when I turn on the cursor to do something the SAS gets deactivated during that time and my ship goes wild.

 

Is there a work around for this or is it a bug?
I have this problem also.  It's not a big deal when your not firing an engine but otherwise it totally goes crazy when you really didn't intend to turn it off.
This is an issue on XBone as well. It's not too terrible but it definitely does limit your ability to multitask.

On ‎7‎/‎20‎/‎2016 at 0:05 PM, Homedawgian said:

This is an issue on XBone as well. It's not too terrible but it definitely does limit your ability to multitask.

For me this seems to almost make the SAS useless in space - the ability to hold my course while I'm doing other stuff is what I need it for!!

I'm glad to see this is a bug and not a "feature" though - hopefully it gets fixed in one of the early TUs.
Shoot, this is a bug? It's so reliable on my game I assumed it was just a bad feature. It's atrociously cumbersome while landing on the Mun, especially. Devs, get patchin'!

no, it makes it unplayable at the Moment...

but the worst thin is: If you leave your ship (for landing on the moon for example), and then re-rendevouz in Orbit and want to go back to the mothership... that mothership spins, which makes it impossible to get back into the capsule
